html: Curses extend to being pursued by enemies—the Assyrian alliance—and being devoured by wild beasts. These, however, are synonymous ideas: “Their arrows are sharp; all their bows are strung. The tread of their warhorses resembles flint; their chariot wheels revolve like a whirlwind. They have the roar of alion ; they are aroused like young lions: growling, they seize the prey, and escape, and none comes to the rescue” ( Isaiah 5:28-29; emphasis added). Jehovah’s righteous people, on the other hand, are gathered out: “The ransomed of Jehovah shall return; they shall come singing to Zion” ( Isaiah 35:10).
